ai:cl.c: Loads and saves picture files in a variety of different data formats.

ai:a.c: Loads image data into a picture object.
Retrieves the latest information from an object.
Reads raw image data from a Picture object.
ai:a.p: ERR acRead(*Object, APTR Buffer, INT Length, INT *Result)

ai:i.c: Points a buffer that will receive the data.
The total number of bytes to read from the object. This value cannot exceed the size of the Buffer.
The Read action will write this parameter with the total number of bytes read into the Buffer.

ai:a.c: Refreshes a loaded picture - draws the next frame.
Saves the picture image to a data object.
ai:a.p: ERR acSaveImage(*Object, OBJECTID Dest, CLASSID ClassID)

ai:i.c: Refers to an object that will receive the encoded image data.
The Picture class to use for encoding the image data.

ai:a.c: Saves the picture image to a data object.
ai:a.p: ERR acSaveToObject(*Object, OBJECTID Dest, CLASSID ClassID)

ai:i.c: Refers to an object that will receive the encoded data.
Can refer to a sub-class that should be used when encoding the data.

ai:a.c: Seeks to a new read/write position within a Picture object.
ai:a.p: ERR acSeek(*Object, DOUBLE Offset, INT Position)

ai:i.c: The desired offset to seek to, relative to the Position parameter.
The position that defines the starting point for Offset.

ai:a.c: Writes raw image data to a picture object.
ai:a.p: ERR acWrite(*Object, APTR Buffer, INT Length, INT Result)

ai:i.c: A buffer containing the data that will be written to the object.
The total number of bytes to write to the object.
This parameter with be updated with the total number of bytes written from the Buffer.

ai:f.c: The name of the person or company that created the image.
The disclaimer associated with an image.
The preferred height to use when displaying the image.
The preferred width to use when displaying the image.
Contains the first 32 bytes of data in a picture's file header.
Refers to a Bitmap that imposes a mask on the image.
The location of source image data.
Defines the quality level to use when saving the image.
The name of the application that was used to draw the image.
